page.title: 17Birds and Birdwatching
page.content: In class 4 nearly everyone loves birds. I am very keen. Alison and I are always asking to watch birds at playtime from our classroom window, it over looks our wild garden area. This year we have kept good records and seen some very interesting and unusual ones. A Cuckoo,a Bearded Tit,a Bullfinch, many Fieldfares, Redwings, and a Jenny Wren. Birds that are common to our school grounds all the year round are - Tree Sparrow, Robin, Pigeon, Barnaby Dove, Pied Wagtail, House Sparrow, Great Tit, Chaffinch, Blue Tit (regularly nests), GreenFinch, Starling, Magpie, Rook, Blackbird, Crow, and Yellow Hammer. We feed the birds during the winter and have noticed we now have many varieties due to our pond and garden.
